page.title: 13TINTWISTLE IN LONGDENDALE
page.content: The village of Tintwistle, 12 miles east of Manchester and a mile north west of Hadfield station, overlooks Longdendale. Up to 1974 it was in Cheshire but is now in Derbyshire. The main road through the village is part of the busy Woodhead Road, the main route from Manchester into Yorkshire. It suffers from heavy traffic most of the day. Many of the houses are 19th century and are built of gritstone from the local quarries, now no longer working. Many of these houses have been renovated. There is a small village green in the centre of the village. There are two reservoirs - Bottoms and Arnfield. A large house is attached to Arnfield Reservoir and is used as a Field Study Centre by Manchester Education Committee.
